text: The scientist who introduced binomial nomenclature in the classification of organisms was
explanation: Carolus Linnaeus, the swedish naturalist, is the man behind this present way of classifying plants and animals.

text: Which of the following statements is true about arthropods?
explanation: The prothorax contains the first pair of legs in the arthropods. It's the first of the three segments of the thorax.

text: What level of organization is Spirogyra?
explanation: Unicellular organisms like the Amoeba, Spirogyra etc fall in the cellular level of organization.

text: The streaming movement of cytoplasm within the Paramecium is known as
explanation: Cyclosis is also called Cytoplasmic streaming. It is defined as the streaming rotary motion of the protoplasm within certain cells and unicellular organisms. Paramecium is an example of a unicellular organism.

text: Which of the following organelles is found only in plant cells?
explanation: Plastids are found only in plants and algae. One common type of plastid is the chloroplast.

text: Active transport differs from diffusion in that active transport

options.B: allows the movement of substances against concentration gradient
options.C: takes place in both light and dark reaction of photosynthesis
options.D: occurs in both plant and animal tissues

explanation: Diffusion, as well as osmosis depends only on concentration gradient but active transport works against concentration gradient.

text: The diagrams above are illustrations of an experimental set-up to demonstrate a type of tropic response in plants. The type of response demonstrated is
explanation: From the first diagram, you notice the roots of the plants bending towards the porous water pot, hence this is a form of response in the direction of the stimuli of the water. This is a form of hydrotropism.

text: The conclusion drawn from the experiment in the diagram above is that

options.A: shoots of plants are negatively thigmotropic
options.B: shoots of plants are negatively geotropic
options.C: shoots of plants are positively phototropic
options.D: roots of plants are positively hydrotropic

explanation: The roots of the plants in diagram 1 bend towards the porous clay pot while growing and the well watered soil sees the plants growing straight and erect. The roots of the plants are positively hydrotropic (respond towards the pull of water positively).

text: The odontoid process is found on the
explanation: The odontoid process is a projection of the axis vetebra. It is seen at its point of joining with the body.

text: A seedling was made to stand in a solution of red ink for three hours and a transverse section of the stem was examined under the microscope. The process being investigated was

options.A: the importance of micro elements to plants
options.B: ascent of water through the xylem

explanation: click here

text: Which of the following structures would carry out cellular respiration? A
explanation: Germinating seeds respire by using oxygen and producing carbon dioxide gas, they respire in the similar way as animals.

text: Which of the following is NOT an excretory product of animals?
explanation: Animals take in oxygen in respiratory process, taking out carbondioxide.

text: An example of homeostasis in living organisms is

options.A: cooling effect resulting from evaporation of water from the body surface
options.B: root hairs of a plant growing towards the source of light
options.C: changing of the body colour of chameleon to match the colour of the foliage on which it is resting
options.D: the release of phosphorus into the phloem of a plant growing in a phosphorus-deficient soil

explanation: Homeostasis is a living organism's way of maintaining a stable internal environment even in the event of external environmental changes. When the plant keeps supplying phosphorus to the phloem even in the case of a deficiency in the soil, it maintains a steady balance on its inside irrespective of the lack in the soil.

text: Ultrafiltration in the kidney takes place in the
explanation: The fine structure of the glomerulus and Bowman’s capsule facilitate ultrafiltration. It is the non-specific filtration of the blood under high pressure and occurs in the Bowman’s capsule of the nephron.

text: The thyroid gland is found at the base of the
explanation: The thyroid gland is an endocrine gland located at the base of the neck.

text: Which of the following statements about the response of neurones to stimulus is correct?

options.A: Neurons respond to stimulus of any strength
options.B: Neurons respond to all stimuli applied in rapid succession
options.C: Neurons respond more rapidly during the absolute refraction period
options.D: Intensity of stimulus must reach a threshold value before the neurons can be excited

explanation: Each neuron has a threshold that must be met before an action potential travels the length of the neurons axon. In other words, the neurons don't just begin to act immediately, there is a threshold value where the intensity of the stimulus must get to in order to yield a response from the neuron. This is why you can consciously pinch your self and not feel anything serious but when it is unconscious, it gives you serious pain.

text: Which of the following practices may lead to infection of the eye? Use of
explanation: Contact lenses have a way of causing infections to the eyes at some point. It can cause a lack of oxygen since they are worn directly in the eye, especially if worn for long periods at a stretch.

text: The structures for gaseous exchange in breathing roots are
explanation: Breathing roots, also known as pneumatophores, have portions of the root which grow upward until they project some centimetres above the low-tide level. They have small openings called lenticels in their bark so that air can reach the rest of the plant’s root system.

text: The diagram above is an illustration of the life cycle of an insect. The adult fly in this cycle is called
explanation: From the diagram, the larva is a caterpillar, hence, the adult is called a Butterfly.

text: In the diagram above, the larva is also known as
explanation: The diagram is the life cycle of a butterfly whose larva is called Caterpillar.

text: The source of energy required by plants during food production is
explanation: The food production process (photosynthesis) makes use of the energy of light for the process.

text: One major difference between plant and animals nutrition is the ability of plants to synthesize
explanation: The food produced by plants serve as food both for the plants and animals (herbivores and in extension, all animals.)

text: By what process is starch converted into maltose?
explanation: Carbohydrates are broken down into their component sugars by hydrolysis. This type of hydrolysis is called Saccharification.

text: The ascent of water in tall trees is mainly due to
explanation: Transpiration pull or the suction force is the force which aids in drawing the water upward from roots to leaves which is used by the leaves for photosynthesis and excess is released through the stomata.

text: The duodenum of a person was surgically removed. Which of the following substances would have their digestion affected?
explanation: These three (starch, protein and lipids) have a process to undergo in the duodenum (the beginning of the small intestine), therefore, the surgery will affect them.

text: Which of the following dental formulae represents the dentition in rabbits?
explanation: The normal dental formula of rabbits is I2/1 C0/0 P3/2 M3/3 for 28 teeth.

text: The diagram above is an illustration of an experimental set-up to demonstrate a property of soil. The property of soil demonstrated is
explanation: The setup is to show the capillarity (water rise) of each of the soil types

text: Which of the following statements would be a correct observation at the end of the experiment? Water moves

options.C: to the same level in all soil types

explanation: Capillarity in soil refers to the ability of a soil to allow and retain water in it. Clayey soil has the highest tendency to hold water hence, the water would rise highest in it.

text: The most important factor(s) that influence(s) the ecological niche of an organism is/ are the
explanation: The competition in a territory is the factor that basically determines whether or not a specie will survive or not in that territory. Ecological niche is the total package of the habits of a specie. The competition for food and water is the most important influencer of the ecological niche.

text: The diagram above is an illustration of organisms in an air-tight aquarium.The most important factor needed by the organisms is
explanation: Proper light in the aquarium serves as a form of energy for the photosynthetic plants and animals, hence is very important.

text: Which of the following instruments is used to determine the turbidity of water?
explanation: The secchi disc is used to check for the transparency and the turbidity of water.

text: In an ecosystem, the least efficient energy transfer link is from the
explanation: From the food chain, the energy flows from the producers to the primary consumer to the secondary consumers and about 90% of the energy is lost in the process of this transfer. Hence, the energy level by the time it gets to the secondary consumers, there is less energy transferred to the decomposers.

text: Xerophytes have the following characteristics aimed at conserving water except
explanation: The xerophytes have reduced leaf size in order to reduce the surface area, thereby reducing the water loss in the plant.

text: An association between living organisms in which one lives on and feeds at the expense of the other is known as
explanation: A parasite is an organism that lives on or in a host organism and gets its food from or at the expense of its host.

text: When large numbers of organisms share limited space and resources, the immediate result is
explanation: Competition in a territory is as a result of a hassle for the available resources within the territory. For instance, when the water in a river seems to be drying out,  the organisms in the water begin to compete for the water.

text: Which of the following disease ic caused by a bacterium?
explanation: Syphilis is caused by a bacterium known as Trepenoma pallidum. It is majorly passed on by sex.

text: Conservation of wildlife is necessary mainly because

options.A: wild species cannot resist disease better than their domesticated species
options.B: many predator wild animals help in the control of pests
options.D: many people derive pleasure from observing wild animals

explanation: Wildlife conservation is necessary for the prevention of the extinction of wildlife. It helps with the preservation of these wild animals.

text: Patients X and Y were likely transferred with blood of genotype
explanation: The blood types A and AB can receive blood from blood types A and O but not B. Hence, if there was a problem after transfusion, it was most likely to be from BO.

text: What should the hospital have done to prevent X from showing the symptom described above? Patient X should have

options.B: been asked for the blood group

explanation: The basic technique in identification of the antigens and antibodies of blood groups is the agglutination test and can be done to prevent the clumping of the red blood cell. The symptom is due to clumping due to incompatible blood transfusion.

text: The greatest contribution to genetic studies was made by
explanation: Gregor Mendel is considered as the founder of modern science of genetics.

text: The exchange of genes between homologous chromosomes is called
explanation: Crossing over is the process where homologous chromosomes pair up with each other and exchange different segments of genetic material to form recombinant chromosomes.

text: The diagrams above are illustrations of the inheritance of coat colour in mice. J, K, L, M and N are parents. The cross between two parent mice gave rise to offspring P, Q, R and S. Which of the offspring are all homozygous?
explanation: click here

text: Genes that remain linked are those

options.A: close to each other on the chromosomes
options.B: on the same locus on the chromosomes

explanation: Linked genes are genes that are found near each other on the same chromosome.

text: A plant cell has 14 chromosomes prior to mitosis. What is the number of chromosomes in the daughter cells?
explanation: Mitosis is a process of cell reproduction in which one cell gives rise to two genetically identical daughter cells of the same number. Hence, the daughter cell has the same number as the parent cell prior to the process.

text: The chemical bond that holds the bases of the two strands of DNA together is
explanation: Hydrogen bonds form between the nitrogenous bases in one strand and the nitrogenous bases in the other strand of DNA;

text: The diagram above is an illustration of one of the theories of evolution. Who proposed the theory in the illustration?
explanation: This is the law of use and disuse propounded by Jean-Baptiste Lamarck.

text: The theory supports

options.D: the use and disuse of body parts

explanation: The theory implies that the more you use a part of your body, with time that part of your body starts adjusting in order to make the work easy.

text: In evolution, fossils are naturally preserved in
explanation: Some sedimentary rocks actually have fossils stored in them. Therefore, fossils are stored in rocks.

text: Which of the following is not a social insect?
explanation: Social insects are characterized by Group integration (blending the new members into the already existing social structure), Division of labour and Overlap of generations (having several breeding seasons, hence having multiple generations present at a time).
